catalyst.source: Ga 2 O 3 supported by metal oxides (referred as Ga 2 O 3 /metal oxide) were prepared by an impregnation method.
catalyst.context: 2.1 Preparation of Ga 2 O 3 /Metal Oxide Photocatalyst Samples. Ga 2 O 3 supported by metal oxides (referred as Ga 2 O 3 /metal oxide) were prepared by an impregnation method. 18In brief, Ga(NO 3 ) 3 8H 2 O (Kishida Chemical Co. Ltd. purity 99.0) and one of the supporting oxides listed in Table 1 were put in 200 mL of distilled water and stirred with a magnetic stirrer in air and dried, followed by calcination at 823 K for 4 h.The amount of Ga 2 O 3 supported on a metal oxide was set to be 40 wt.Unsupported Ga 2 O 3 samples having single phase either -Ga 2 O 3 or -Ga 2 O 3 were also prepared for comparison.-Ga 2 O 3 was obtained by calcining Ga 2 O 3 nH 2 O (Mitsuwa Chemicals Co., Lid Ga 2 O 3 78.8) at 823 K for 5 h. 19or the preparation of -Ga 2 O 3 , Ga(NO 3 ) 3 8H 2 O was dissolved in ethanol (approximately 3 g of the reagent in 50 mL of the solvent), and then an ethanol solution of 28 vol aqueous ammonia (volume ratio of ethanol/aqueous ammonia 1) was added slowly under continuous stirring at room temperature until no further precipitates were formed.The resultant precipitates were filtered, rinsed in ethanol, and vacuum-dried in a desiccator.Finally, the obtained solid was calcined at 773 K for 5 h to obtain -Ga 2 O 3 . 20.2 Characterization.UVvis diffuse reflectance spectra were recorded at room temperature using a spectrometer (JASCO V-670).The spectrum of Ba 2 SO 4 was used as reference. The potential position of the conduction band of the supporting oxides was determined by the Mott-Schottky-plot from the flat band potential measured with a three-electrode chemical cell (VersaSTAT4 (AMETEK)). 2123The following three electrodes were used.(1) a metal oxide dispersed on a fluorinedoped tin oxide substrate followed by calcination at 823 K, (2) a Pt wire counter electrode, and (3) an Ag/AgCl reference electrode, and an aqueous Na 2 SO 4 solution (0.5 M, pH 7.4).The flat band potential (E 0 ) of the oxide at pH 0 vs SHE (standard hydrogen electrode) was extrapolated from the observed potential (E) using the relation of E E 0 -0.059pH and the electrode potential of Ag/AgCl was set to be 0.199V (vs.SHE, 25 C). Crystalline structures of all Ga 2 O 3 /metal oxide samples were examined by X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis.XRD patterns of the samples were recorded on a MiniFlex600 (Rigaku) using Cu K as a radiation source with an operating voltage of 40 kV and current of 15 mA.The XRD patterns were collected at 2 angles of 2070.The 2 step width was 0.02, and the scanning rate was 2/min.Ga K-edge EXAFS was measured with the beam line BL5S1 at Aichi Synchrotron Radiation Center.Ga K-edge EXAFS was obtained by a transmission mode.Morphology of the samples was observed by a field emission scanning electron microscope (FE-SEM, JSM-6500F, JEOL Ltd.) with a backscattered electron mode under an acceleration voltage of 15 kV. 2.3 Photocatalytic CO 2 Reduction and Water Splitting Tests.Photocatalytic CO 2 reduction with H 2 O under UV light irradiation was tested for 0.1 g of each of the Ga 2 O 3 /metal oxide samples set in a fixed-bed flow reactor cell under CO 2 gas flow.The UV light intensity was 40 mW/cm 2 in the range of 254 10 nm.Before the test, the sample was irradiated with a 300 W Xe lamp for 1 h under CO 2 gas flow with the flow rate of 20.0 mL/min.The reduction test was conducted as follows.First, a 10.0 mL NaHCO 3 aqueous solution 24 (1.0 M) with a sample was prepared.The pH of the solution was 8.7.Then, CO 2 gas was introduced with a flow rate of 3.0 mL/min under the UV light irradiation.This made the pH a little lower being 7.8, which was maintained during the reaction tests.After stopping the UV light and CO 2 gas flow, pH increased a little to 8.4.The reaction products (CO, H 2 , and O 2 ) were analyzed by a gas chromatograph equipped with a thermal conductivity detector.
